intro: Telis cretica, commonly known as the Cretan telis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring finely divided leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone areas. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
